title: [Aten] at::randint doesn't return a variable
body_html:
🐛 Bug

There is a behavior mismatch between at::normal (for example), which returns a variable, and at::randint, that doesn't.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

auto v1 = at::normal(torch::zeros({23, 32}));
std::cout << v1.type().toString() << std::endl;
// prints Variable[CPUFloatType]

auto v2 = at::randint(100, {45, 2});
std::cout << v2.type().tString() << std::endl;
// prints CPUFloatType

Expected behavior

Both functions should return variables

Environment

Happens on recent master.
